name: wearefrank
description: A plugin to help users with the development of their Frank!Framework integrations!

walkthroughs.title: Get Started with Frank!Framework
walkthroughs.description: This walkthrough shows you how the Frank!Framework extension helps you create, configure, run, and understand Frank projects.

steps.title: Open or Create a Frank Project
steps.description: In the Activity Bar, open the Frank!Framework Welcome view. From here you can either open an existing Frank project or create a new one. Creating a new project clones the Frank!Runner and a skeleton project into your workspace. You will be asked to give the new project a name.

steps.title: Run Your Project
steps.description: Run your project using Ant, Docker, or Docker Compose from the Start! view in the Explorer. At the top you'll see the current project, choose your start method and hover over it to reveal the button to run it.

steps.title: Run Previous Projects Again
steps.description: Previously run projects are saved so you can easily start them again from the Start! view.

steps.title: Visualize Your Configuration
steps.description: When working with a Frank configuration file, the flowchart is shown in the Secondary Sidebar. It visualizes how your configuration works and updates automatically when you save changes or switch between configuration files.

steps.title: Add an Adapter to Your Configuration
steps.description: In the Explorer, open the Adapters! view and click “Add Adapter”. Choose an adapter type from the list and it will be inserted into the file currently open in your editor.

steps.title: Use Built-in Snippets
steps.description: Snippets are automatically loaded from the Frank!Framework Wiki. Each component has at least one snippet, and some have multiple. Start typing the component name to see available snippets and insert them into your configuration.

steps.title: Create a Custom Snippet
steps.description: Select text in the editor, right-click, and choose “Add Frank! Snippet”. Enter a name to save the selected text as your own snippet.

media.altText: Create a Frank snippet from selected text

steps.title: View Your Snippets
steps.description: Your custom snippets appear in the Frank! Snippets view in the Explorer. Snippets are grouped by name, and each group can contain multiple snippets.

media.altText: Frank Snippets view in the Explorer

steps.title: Manage and Edit Snippets
steps.description: Click a snippet or snippet group to open the management view. Here you can rename collections, edit snippet prefixes, descriptions, and content, add new snippets, or delete existing ones. If you want to share a snippet with others, use the button in the top right to submit it to the Frank!Framework Wiki.

media.altText: Manage Frank snippets in the webview

steps.title: Open Component Documentation
steps.description: Components with available documentation are underlined in the editor. Hold Ctrl (or Cmd on macOS) and click the component name to open its Frank!Doc page in your browser.

viewsWelcome.contents:
Welcome to the Frank!Framework!
The Frank!Framework is an easy-to-use, stateless integration framework which allows (transactional) messages to be modified and exchanged between different systems.
[Open a Frank](command:vscode.openFolder)
[Create a Frank](command:frank.createNewFrank)
